title.narrative: Independent Medico Legal Unit - Up scaling torture prevention and response mechanisms in Kenya

description.narrative: The country is witnessing increasing deaths from police use of lethal force against suspected criminals and execution and enforced disappearances of terror suspects and in circumstances that suggest police involvement. Accountability for deaths in custody and from police use of firearms continues to be a challenge amidst a weak medico-legal documentation system. This situation is made more complex by a public opinion that supports police use of lethal force to tackle crime coupled with intolerance to human rights NGOs? call for strict adherence to the rule of law. This situation has also had implications on the status of refugees and asylum seekers in Kenya as they increasingly become victims of police excesses.We continue to witness resistance to police ref orm at various levels including the continuous attempts to use the judiciary to stall police vetting delays in funding the National Police Service Commission among others. The increasing propensity by the legislature and executive to disobey court orders d oes not augur well for rule of law either.Other challenges include threats to witnesses. These threats including those related to the ICC cases continue to pose a serious challenge to the fight against impunity and access to justice for many victims of tor ture and others forms of ill-treatment extra-judicial executions gender based violence and economic crimes. The possible collapse of the ICC cases and what that portends for the civil society space the fight against impunity and enhancement of accountabili ty in Kenya. These developments dictate that we reposition ourselves to ensure that we respond in a relevant effective and efficient manner consolidating existing and developing new partnerships where none existed before deepening our research policy analy sis and proposals, deepening our efforts at safeguarding public participation and engagement in governance, reaching out and providing technical support to the executive the judiciary and parliament, and improving accountability tracking mechanisms to ensu re that these institutions retain their fidelity to the constitution and respond to the aspirations of the Kenyan people.
